Title: Response Format Inconsistency
Description: No standardized response structure across API endpoints. Patterns range from good (Pattern A) to broken (Pattern C with 'as any'). Clients must handle multiple formats.

Title: Hard-coded Bearer Token in /api/user/profile
Description: Production code contains hard-coded test Bearer token 'Bearer expired-token'. Returns mock test data unrelated to caller. Not using middleware auth.

Title: Authentication Fragmentation (NextAuth + Firebase + Bearer)
Description: Three different auth systems active simultaneously. Different property names (.uid vs .id) cause type mismatch bugs. No consolidated auth strategy.

Title: Input Validation Inconsistency
Description: Some routes use Zod + sanitization (good). Others use manual checks or no validation. Some expose validation errors. No centralized validation middleware.

Title: Error Handling Patterns Inconsistent
Description: Multiple error response formats. Some routes expose internal details (security risk). No correlation IDs for debugging. Inconsistent HTTP status codes.

Title: Rate Limiting Missing on User/Public Endpoints
AffectedFiles: app/api/user/profile, app/api/user/stats, app/api/daily-quiz, app/api/daily-quiz/status, app/api/quiz/submit, app/api/quizzes
Description: Only auth endpoints (/api/auth/register, /api/auth/login) have rate limiting. Public/user endpoints unprotected from DoS and scraping attacks.

Title: Request Tracing & Observability Gaps
Description: Only auth endpoints generate request IDs. Other routes lack tracing capability. Hard to trace requests through logs for debugging.

Title: API Documentation Gaps
Description: Some routes well-documented with JSDoc. Others poorly documented or missing parameter documentation. No OpenAPI/Swagger definitions.

Title: Type Safety Issues
Description: Unsafe casting with 'as any' loses type safety. Untyped result handling. Other routes properly typed.

Title: No Standard Response Format
Description: Clients must handle Pattern A (good), Pattern B (problematic), Pattern C (broken with 'as any'), and Pattern D (raw data). Makes error handling fragile and API unpredictable.

Title: Provider Nesting Complexity
Description: 5 nested providers (SessionProvider > ReactQueryProvider > ResponsiveUIProvider > FirebaseProvider > PerformanceProvider). Potential hydration mismatches. Dual auth systems cause type mismatch bugs. FirebaseProvider doesn't provide context.

Title: React Query Usage Inconsistency
Description: Three different query hook implementations with inconsistent config: staleTime varies (5min to 1hr), gcTime varies (30min to 24hrs), retry varies (2-3). Same data could cache for vastly different durations.

Title: Authentication State Fragmentation
Description: Three sources of truth for user identity: Firebase useAuth() (.uid), NextAuth session (.id), hard-coded Bearer token. Type mismatch bugs. Hard-coded test values in production.

Title: Firebase Real-time Listener Synchronization Issues
Description: Multiple subscriptions: React Query cache + local state + real-time listener. Three sources of truth for friend data. Race conditions possible (friend data out of sync with presence).

Title: Cache Invalidation Chaos
Description: Three different cache invalidation patterns. No centralized rules. Components can forget to invalidate after mutations. useFriendCache exists but not used consistently.

Title: localStorage as Cache Layer (Anti-Pattern)
Description: Bypasses React Query logic with localStorage. Can fail silently in private browsing. Synchronization issues between tabs. No cleanup (localStorage keeps growing). Race conditions.

Title: Mock Data Baked into Production
Description: Mock data enabled automatically with shouldUseMockData(). Can't be disabled without code changes. Silent fallback masks actual API failures. Testing against mock, not real API.

Title: Prop Drilling Despite State Management
Description: Hooks exist but props drilled 3+ levels anyway (user, uiScale). Causes unnecessary re-renders.

Title: Excessive Hydration Mismatch Prevention
Description: Three separate isClient state variables doing the same thing. Causes 3 unnecessary re-renders before hydration completes.

Title: Performance Monitoring Overhead
Description: Large wrapper functions with disabled defaults. Adds overhead even when trackPerformance=false. Bundle bloat. No control over when hooks run.

Title: State Management Decision Tree Unclear
Description: Too many options: useAuth() vs await auth() vs Bearer token, useOptimizedQuery vs useQuery vs useDailyQuiz vs useLeaderboard, useResponsiveUI vs useState vs local state. Developers must understand 4+ systems.

Title: N+1 Query in FriendService.getFriends()
Description: Gets friendships (1 query) then loops making individual getDoc for each friend (100 queries) + mutual friends count (100 queries) + online status (100 queries). With 100 friends: 301 queries instead of ~3.

Title: Friend Activity 'in' Operator Limit
Description: Firestore 'in' operator limited to 10 items. With >10 friends, query silently fails for rest. Silent data loss - no error thrown. Users with >10 friends miss activity from friends 11+.

Title: N+1 in User Search
Description: Search query (1) + current user friends (1) + pending requests (1) + mutual friends for each result (20 queries). For 20-user search: 23+ queries minimum.

Title: Inefficient Leaderboard Rank Calculation
Description: Queries ALL documents with higher scores for every calculation. At 1000 leaderboard entries: 1000+ documents scanned per submission. O(n) cost per update.

Title: Missing Firestore Composite Indexes
Description: Only 2 composite indexes defined. Need 8+ for: leaderboards (period+score), friend requests (toUserId+status), friend activities (userId+createdAt), questions (categoryId+isActive), etc. Missing indexes cause 10-20x slower queries.

Title: Denormalized User Data
Description: User displayNames and avatars stored in 4+ places (users, leaderboards, friendships, friend_requests, challenges). Profile updates leave stale data across collections. Risk of inconsistency.

Title: No Query Result Caching
Description: Quiz, question, and category queries fetched fresh each time. No memoization for repeated queries. Repeated fetches waste quota.

Title: Real-time Listener Broadcasts All Presence
Description: Listens to entire 'presence' collection for ALL users. Receives updates for all users then filters client-side. Unnecessary bandwidth and processing.

Title: No Cascade Delete on Quiz Removal
Description: If quiz deleted, Questions docs (referenced) and QuizAttempts docs still exist as orphans. No cascade delete or cleanup implemented.

Title: Incomplete Firestore Security Rules
Description: Only 2 rule blocks defined. Missing rules for: leaderboards, achievements, friend_requests, friendships, notifications, challenges. Queries to unmapped collections fail silently.

Title: Production Metrics Export Disabled
Description: Code to send metrics to analytics service is commented out. Web Vitals + network/resource tracking gated behind dev-only showDashboard. Production metrics remain in-memory and lost on page reload.

Title: Memory Leak in useBenchmark Frame Tracking
Description: Frame timing array grows unbounded. At 60fps: 60 entries/second. Component visible 5 minutes = 18,000 array entries. Multiple components = 3x+ memory overhead. Never cleared.

Title: useBenchmark Runs in Production for RiveAnimation
Description: useBenchmark enabled by default with no 'enabled' flag. Rive animations run this in PRODUCTION, not dev. Memory leak (Issue 4.2) is a production risk.

Title: Incomplete Web Vitals Coverage
Description: Only tracks CLS, FID, LCP. Missing INP (newly critical metric per Google 2024) and TTFB. INP replaced FID but code still uses deprecated FID.

Title: Dynamic Import on Every Navigation
Description: web-vitals library imported on EVERY route change. Previous observers not cleaned up. Memory inefficient. Only runs when showDashboard is true (dev-only).

Title: Monitoring Gated to Dev-Only showDashboard
Description: NavigationMetricsTracker and useNetworkMonitor only run when showDashboard=true. Web Vitals and network metrics effectively disabled in production. Leaves no production visibility.

Title: React Query Metrics Not Tracked
Description: Infrastructure exists (MetricType.QUERY/MUTATION, getPerformanceSummary). No data collection. React Query hooks only emit CUSTOM metrics when trackPerformance=true. Major data operations completely unmonitored.

Title: Component Metrics Record Zero Values
Description: Render/mount/unmount events always record value:0 (no duration). Time-on-screen recorded under MetricType.COMPONENT mixing semantics. Actual render duration never captured. 'Slowest components' is misleading.

Title: Redundant Monitoring Systems
Description: Three separate metric collection systems identical in structure. Each has 1000 metric max. 3x memory overhead. Inconsistent metrics. Maintenance burden (changes in 3 places). Confusing which to use where.

Title: No Error Differentiation in Measurements
Description: Error and success paths call endMeasurement identically. Errors not flagged in metrics. Slow errors look like slow operations. No separation of error response times from normal latency.

Title: Global Fetch Monkeypatching
Description: Global fetch replacement. Could conflict with libraries. Full URL in metric name creates unbounded unique metrics. Every fetch tracked. Only enabled when showDashboard=true (dev-only).

Title: Web Vitals Re-Registered on Navigation
Description: Web-vitals listeners re-register on every navigation. No cleanup of previous observers. Memory inefficiency. Only runs when showDashboard=true (dev-only).

Title: PerformanceDashboard Uses Fake Data
Description: Simulated metrics (Math.random()). Runtime error: setShowDetails is undefined. Dashboard doesn't reflect real metrics. Not mounted anywhere by default.

Title: Misleading Slowest Components Summary
Description: Uses MetricType.COMPONENT for 'slowest components' but that type records time-on-screen and excessive renders, not render duration. Can't identify slow renders.

Title: Network Monitor Load Listener Not Removed
Description: window.addEventListener('load') handler added but re-mounts can stack handlers. Only runs when showDashboard=true (dev-only).

Title: Performance Dashboard Mounted Twice in Dev
Description: Dashboard mounted in two places in dev. Duplicate UI and duplicate polling.

Title: useMeasurePerformance autoLog Unused
Description: autoLog flag doesn't disable logging. API misleading about what autoLog controls.

Title: No Metrics Sampling or Rate Limiting
Description: All operations recorded - no sampling for high traffic. Every fetch, resource, render tracked. Could DOS metrics storage in production. 1000 limit reached in seconds under load.

Title: startMeasurement Called Without Category
Description: startMeasurement invokes with only measurement name, missing category. Metrics recorded with missing category. Category-based reporting becomes unreliable.

Title: Over-Mocking Tests
Description: Hooks mocked at module level in their own tests. AuthProvider mocked in its own test. Tests verify mock behavior, not real code. Defeats testing purpose.

Title: API Routes Excluded from Coverage
Description: !app/api/** - No coverage tracking for API routes. Hard-coded test values in production. No visibility into API coverage. Coverage reporting incomplete.

Title: Tests Skipped in CI
Description: itIfEmulatorsRunning skips based on process.env.CI, not emulator availability. Integration tests don't run in CI by default. Emulator startup failures logged but tests continue.

Title: Emulator Tests Never Touch Real Firebase
Description: Global Firebase mocks in jest.setup.ts. createTestUser() and signInTestUser() return mock users. Emulator runs but code never uses it. 'Integration' tests are actually mock-only.

Title: API Tests Mock Firebase Admin
Description: Even with emulator running, FirebaseAdminService mocked. Tests don't test actual Firebase behavior. Mocking both the test and the mock (mock-inception).

Title: Emulator Detection Broken by fetch Mock
Description: jest.setup.ts sets global.fetch = jest.fn(). Emulator checks use fetch() to probe ports. Tests may skip or try to start emulators incorrectly.

Title: Security Tests Mock NextRequest/NextResponse
Description: Tests read response.data (doesn't exist on real NextResponse). Security middleware mocked inside tests. Real Next.js behavior not validated. Mock behavior validated instead.

Title: Test Data Not Isolated
Description: testResources is module-scoped. Shared across tests. Could interfere between tests. Manual cleanup required. No test-scoped isolation.

Title: No Coverage Thresholds Enforced
Description: Coverage only reported when running jest --coverage. No branch/line/function thresholds configured. Gaps can grow without failing CI.

Title: E2E Tests Are Brittle
Description: String and CSS selectors used. Break with UI changes. Only 2 E2E test files. No mobile/responsive testing. Limited coverage.

Title: No Error Path Testing
Description: Tests focus on happy path. Few error scenarios. No timeout/network error tests. Error handling code rarely tested.

Title: Performance Code Not Tested
Description: Performance hooks exist but not tested. Could break silently. No assertions on performance metrics.

Title: E2E Password Reset May Be Flaky
Description: Uses timestamped email that may never be registered. Firebase can return 'user not found'. May pass locally but fail against real Firebase.

Title: No Proper Test Cleanup
Description: beforeEach/afterEach inconsistent. Global state not reset. Tests could be order-dependent. No test isolation.

Title: Test/Diagnostic Auth Endpoints Exposed
Description: No environment guards on test-login, test-signin, test-signup, diagnostics (except create-test-account only blocks in production). Public callers can create/delete users, probe auth behavior, pull server diagnostics.

Title: Hard-coded Bearer Token and Mock Profile
Description: Production code: hard-coded 'Bearer expired-token' returns fixed test data (test-user-id). Auth bypass; endpoint returns data unrelated to caller.

Title: Debug/Test UI Routes Unguarded
Description: Test pages not protected by middleware. Accessible in production if deployed. No NODE_ENV check. Exposes debug tooling, test credentials, Firebase connectivity.

Title: NextAuth Logs User Emails and Stack Traces
Description: Logs user emails during sign-in, JWT token setting, session callbacks. Stack traces logged on auth errors. Sensitive data can leak into logs and monitoring systems.

Title: NextAuth Returns Distinct Auth Errors
Description: Different error messages for 'user not found' vs 'wrong password'. Email enumeration risk - attackers can determine which emails exist.

Title: Security Middleware Not Wired
Description: Intended protections defined in middleware files but not active. Active middleware.ts only wraps NextAuth. Headers/CSRF/rate-limit/fingerprint checks not enforced. API routes fall back to minimal middleware.

Title: CSP Too Permissive
Description: CSP allows 'unsafe-inline' and 'unsafe-eval'. Injected via meta tags only (not response headers). Doesn't cover API responses. Allows inline data URLs for images.

Title: Public Quiz Endpoints Unauthenticated
Description: No auth check. Data scraping and abuse risk. No rate limiting. Could be called by bots/automated scrapers.

Title: Firebase Admin Credentials Handling
Description: Credentials loaded from env var (better to use file-based). Credentials can be exposed via env/logs. ADC fallback may mask misconfigurations.

Title: Two Build Config Files Exist
Description: Both files present with different configs. Unclear which Next.js loads (usually .js takes precedence). typescript.ignoreBuildErrors in .js but not .ts. Config drift already present.

Title: ignoreBuildErrors in Build Config
Description: typescript.ignoreBuildErrors: true in next.config.js. Production builds succeed with type errors. Defeats TypeScript purpose. Type errors can ship to production.

Title: No Pre-Deploy Tests
Description: GitHub Actions workflows don't run tests before deployment. No linting. No type checking in CI. Could deploy broken code.

Title: Missing Build Step in CI
Description: Merge workflow runs npm ci but no visible npm run build. Root firebase.json has no predeploy hooks. hosting.public: 'build' never generated in CI. Build output missing from deployments.

Title: No Node Version Pinned
Description: CI uses default Node version. Could change between runs. Should pin to specific version (e.g., 18). Functions declare Node 22 (mismatch risk).

Title: Overly Permissive Image Config
Description: remotePatterns allows protocol: https, hostname: **, pathname: **. Allows images from ANY HTTPS domain. No restrictions. CSRF/SSRF attack risk. Should whitelist specific domains.

Title: Firebase Hosting Config Drift
Description: Root points to public: 'build'. firebase/ points to public: 'public'. Root omits functions/dataconnect from nested config. App Hosting yaml exists but no workflow uses it. Ambiguity about deploy target.

Title: Type Check Not Integrated into Build
Description: type-check script exists but not part of build or CI. TypeScript strict mode enabled but ignored at build (ignoreBuildErrors). Type checking becomes optional manual step.

Title: build:no-types Script Misleading
Description: SKIP_TYPE_CHECK env var set but no config reads it. With ignoreBuildErrors: true, build and build:no-types behave identically. Encourages false sense of control.

Title: Multiple Build Methods
Description: Four different build variants. Developers might use wrong one. No guidance on which to use when. Turbo and no-types lack clear purpose.

Title: Linting Not Integrated with Build/CI
Description: npm run lint exists but not wired into CI. Linting effectively optional. ESLint extends only Next.js defaults. No custom rules documented.

Title: TypeScript Target Too Old
Description: Targets es5 produces larger bundles. Modern browsers don't need es5. Should be es2020+ for modern builds. Unnecessary transpilation.

Title: skipLibCheck Enabled
Description: Skips type checking of library files. Faster builds but misses library issues. Defeats strict mode purpose.

Title: Documentation Auto-Commits
Description: Generated docs auto-committed to main without approval. Could cause issues if PR not merged. No failure notification.

Title: No Rollback Capability
Description: Failed deployments not handled. No automatic rollback. No deployment versioning visible.

Title: Limited Error Handling in CI
Description: No notifications on failure. No rollback on failed deployment. Failed PR previews silently ignored. Limited visibility into issues.
